properties.name: Bluhm family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Lupendorf, GermanyMy Dad\'s family immigrated from here in 1854.

properties.name: Brinkmann family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Gustrow, Mecklenberg, GermanyThe ancestral home of the Brinkmann family. My gg grandmother, Johanna Brinkmann, emigrated with her mother (Anna) and her brothers (William and Frederick) in 154 when she was 22 years old. Johanna married Carl Bluhm in Michigan City, IN 1856. It\'s said they were the first German couple married in the city. There are several cities (some closer to where the Bluhm\'s are from) that have a similar name, particularly Gulzow. Still working on confirming which one it is.

properties.name: Deidlof family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Gievitz, Mecklenberg, GermanyAncestral home of Maria Katharina Henriette Deidlof, my ggggg grandmother. She was born there in 1794. She immigrated to the United States sometime after 1850 with her children, settling in Michigan City, IN. Her son, John Ebert, was born in the neighboring village of either Sorgenlos or Deven).

properties.name: Ebert & Voss (Schwarz?) family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Sorgenlos/Deven, Mecklenberg, GermanyThe ancestral home of John Ebert, my gggg grandfather (son of Maria Deidlof who was born in the neighboring village of Gievitz). John was born in 1825 and immigrated to the US sometime after 1850 to the Michigan City, IN area. John was married to Fredericka Voss (Schwarz?) in 1849 in Mecklenberg. She was also born in Deven, in 1823. Fredericka\'s mother\'s name was Mary (her maiden name is unknown).

properties.name: Elizabeth D. [Pearce]
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Tibberton, Gloucestershire, EnglandWife of Joseph Pearce was born here in 1799. Maiden name unknown.

properties.name: Favourite place to see Shakespeare plays
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 stratford, ontarioITwice \'ve gone to the Stratford Shakespeare Festival with my good friend, Beth. It\'s a lovely small Canadian town with great restaurants and shops.

properties.name: Glavin family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Mitchelstown, Co. Cork, IrelandMore than likely the origin of the Glavin family. Richard Glavin was my grandfather (my Mom\'s Dad). His grandfather Edmund, a fruit farmer, immigrated from Ireland to the US in the middle of the 19th century.

properties.name: Grizzly Peak Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8  ann arbor, michiganMy absolute favourite restaurant in Ann Arbor! No one I\'ve taken there has ever been less than happy with the food... and the beer.

properties.name: Heitschmidt family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Pries, Pomerania, GermanyAncestral home of my ggg grandfather, August Heitschmidt Sr. He was born there in 1836. He married Julia Zieman (unknown if it was in Germany or the US) and settled in Chicago, IL. His son A.C. Heitschmidt was a prominant citizen of Michigan City, IN for many years in the early 20th century.

properties.name: Hello! it's meee!
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8

properties.name: Henrietta [Pearce]
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Usk, Caerphilly, WalesBirthplace of my ggg grandmother. Maiden name unknown.

properties.name: Henry Warkentin Sr. & Dorothea Eichelberg
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Neindorf, Mecklenberg, GermanyBirthplace of my ggg grandfather, Henry Warkentin Sr., in 1842. He and his family immigrated in 1864 to the US, settling in Michigan City, IN. His mother, Dorothea [Eichelberg], was also from Niendorf, born about 1820. His father, August, was from the nearby Rothspalk.

properties.name: Howdy!  (megan)
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8

properties.name: In my PJs, avoiding school...
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 I was eating fruit loops and watching the Today show when the report broke thru Katie & Matt\'s broadcast. I think it was right as it was going off the air that morning.

properties.name: John and Henrietta Pearce
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Ross-on-Wye, EnglandWhere the Pearce\'s lived before immigrating to the US. Many of my gg grandmother, Evalyn\'s, siblings were born here.

properties.name: John and Joseph Pearce
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Mitcheldean, EnglandJoseph Pearce b. 1803, my gggg grandfather John Pearce b. 1825/6, my ggg grandfather

properties.name: Katharine Elizabeth [Knott]
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Rassdorf, Hersfeld-Rotenburg, Hessen, GermanyUnknown maiden name. She is my ggg grandmother and was born there in 1820. Later on, she would married Kristof Knott and immigrate to Niles, MI.

properties.name: Knott family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Meimers, Sachsen, GermanyAncestral home of my gg grandfather, Henry Knott. He immigrated to the US on the Ship Attilie on 15 March 1861 (approximately) and settled in Niles, MI. He married Elizabeth Semmelroth Wahl in 1866. They had 4 daughters, one of whom, Louise, married Henry Bluhm in 1907 in Michigan City, IN. Henry was a Civil War Veteran with Company E 12th Michigan Infantry. He met a tragic end when he was hit by a Big Four Train in Niles in 1896.

properties.name: My first apartment
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8   3515 West Ainslie St. Chicago, ILWith one of the greatest influences on my adult life, Elizabeth, and her infamous kittie: Ed.

properties.name: My grad school apartment
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 1210 Saint Paul Street Baltimore, MD 21202Where I lived in good \'ole Baltimore, 2000-2002. I miss that town.

properties.name: My home in London during my semester abroad
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg811 Kenton Gardens, Kenton, London, EnglandThis is where I lived in the Fall/Winter of 1997 with the lovely Shaw family.

properties.name: My most recent Chicago apartment
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg85556 North Lakewood Ave Chicago, IL 60625Lived here 2004-2005 - GORGEOUS Edgewater neighborhood.

properties.name: Our new condo!
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 2998 Roundtree Blvd Ypsilanti, MI 48197Our first home. We\'ll be moving there in the summer.

properties.name: Our new condo!
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 2998 Roundtree Blvd Ypsilanti, MI 48197Our first home. We will be moving here this summer. :)

properties.name: Pearce family sailed from here in 1867
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Liverpool, EnglandThe Pearce family (father John, mother Henrietta, children Elizabeth, William, Ada, Clara, Ellen, and Annie) sailed from here in June of 1867 aboard the SS Tarifa. The ship would land in New York city where the Pearce family would make its way to Terre Haute, IN.

properties.name: School of Art Institute of Chicago's former dorms
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8  112 South Michigan Ave. Chicago, ILMy undergraduate home from 1995-1996. Floor five alive! Miss you Meg & Amy!

properties.name: Semmelroth & Scheidemann family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Nassau, Hessen, GermanyAncestral home of John Heinrich and Anna (Scheidemann) Semmelroth, my gggg grandparents. Their son, Sebastian married Melissa Gigh (in Germany? the US?). They settled in upstate New York in the mid-19th century where my gg grandmother, Elizabeth was born in 1848 (in Rochester). Elizabeth married Henry Knott in 1866 in Niles, MI. and they had 4 girls.

properties.name: The furthest I've been from home
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Kyleakin, Isle of Skye, ScotlandThis is the hostel I stayed in when I returned to the UK in 1999. I was completely enchanted by this place. If I was more of a recluse, I\'d move to this island in a heartbeat.

properties.name: Very frequent stop for pizza during grad school
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Viccino\'s Pizza, Baltimore, MDI used to get a slice of pepperoni wrapped in aluminum foil for about . You couldn\'t beat that after a long day at school.

properties.name: Warkentin family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Rothspalk, Klaber, Mecklenberg, GermanyThe ancestral home of August Warkentin, my gggg grandfather, who was born there around the turn of the 19th century (somewhere between 1793-1816). He and his family immigrated to Michigan City, IN before 1867. His son, Henry (my ggg grandfather) was born in nearby Neindorf in 1842.

properties.name: Where Eric proposed to me :)
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Curtis Park, Saline, MIDuring a wonderful day (in June of 2005) of horsebacking riding and a picnic... the sneaky bastard. hee hee

properties.name: Where I crossed the Mississippi River for the 1st time
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Interstate 80 between Illinois and IowaMy good friend, Beth, and I were taking a roadtrip to the Black Hills of South Dakota.

properties.name: Where I grew up
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 909 Elm Street Michigan City, IN 46360I still call it "home" even though I no longer live there. My parents purchased what we all just loving call "Elm Street" in 1981. From who, you might ask? Why, my fiance Eric\'s parents! Freaky stuff.

properties.name: Where I put my toes in the Pacific for the 1st time
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Asilomar, CaliforniaI love this area of the country. I found myself here for an Association of Medical Illustrators conference in 2001.

properties.name: Where I put my toes in the ocean for the first time
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 barton on sea, englandOn a daytrip with my friend Graham in 1997.

properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8Middletown, OH

properties.name: Where my sister, Kate, goes to school
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8  Westover, WV

properties.name: Ziemann & Rehberg family origin
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 Malchow, Waren, Mecklenberg, GermanyMy gggg grandparents, John Ziemann and Charlotte Rehberg were married here in 1837. They immigrated to the US in 1854 with their 4 children (a boy, Henry, died in Germany). John\'s obituary states that he "has two brothers and a sister in Germany" in 1899.
